page.title: 02BIRDS EYE VIEW OF MALDON
page.content: On a clear day in July standing 60 feet up on the roof of Moot Hall we were suprised by the fantastic view.We could clearly see 15 miles of country- side and the Blackwater Estuary. The first thing you see is the High Street and the roofs of houses and shops.The colours of the roof tiles make a mosaic skyline-red tiles mainly showing old buildings and grey slates the newer buildings.One feature notic- ed was the bend in the High Street not really seen when travelling by car or on foot.The street was noisy and busy. The tide was out and we could see a large expanse of mud flats,Northey and Osea Islands.Bradwell Power station was visible on the horizon and many village steeples and water towers. How we wish we could be birds every day admiring the spectacular view!
